column4: How do I add a command to run at startup like a windows autorun?
simplest is to put it in /etc/rc.local. but yes, how do you think everything gets started on startup?
Kevin': from what I gather there is a startup script with a list of commands to run (at some point in the boot process), I just want to add a command to that list, unless of course I'm way off.
is rc.local run after gnome is started? I'm trying to make avant window manager start automatically.
